unnormalised: Urban planning in India requires a nuanced approach. Considering the rapid growth of cities like Mumbai and Chennai, sustainable strategies are crucial. The 74th Constitutional Amendment Act, 1992, mandated decentralization, but its impact needs further assessment. Efficient land use, affordable housing (especially post-COVID impact), and infrastructure development (e.g., better public transport) are critical. Implementation of projects must be expedited, ideally completed by 20/10/2024, rather than dragging on. The success of initiatives like Smart Cities Mission depends heavily on effective urban governance. Public consultations scheduled for 10:00 hrs on 12/07/2024 are vital to incorporate citizen feedback.
